adverb.description: To or at a distance from a particular place, person, or thing.
examples: she landed badly, and crawled away
they walked away from the church in silence
we'll be away for four nights
there's a river not far away

adverb.description: Into an appropriate place for storage or safekeeping.
examples: he put away the lawn furniture
Philip locked away all the cash every night
Marie felt her distress ebbing away
the sound of hoofbeats died away
there was little Edgar crooning away
have your camera ready and click away when you spot something

adjective.description: (of a sports game) played at the opponents' field or court.
examples: tomorrow night's away game at Yankee Stadium

noun.description: A game played or won by a team at their opponents' field or court.

origin: Old English onweg, aweg on one's way (see a-, way).
